oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: George Hamilton IV Performance - Tape 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tape 2 of 7. Recording of George Hamilton IV and the Country Gentlemen (performance group) from the Arthur Godfrey's Talent Show on October 15, 1956; additionally, there is a recording from Sydney, Australia
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: George Hamilton and the Country Gentlemen
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Arthur Godfrey introduces a miss Adelaide Payton as a judge and asks her of her life goals; Payton and Godfrey go in depth about airplanes while Payton introduces George Hamilton IV -- (02:55) Godfrey jokes about Payton's airline work -- (03:35) Godfrey introduces Hamilton -- (03:47) I've Got a Secret (George Hamilton IV) -- (06:19) Godfrey appreciates Hamilton -- (06:48) Godfrey introduces the shows participants, and starts with the LaDell Sisters -- (06:57) You Don't Owe Me a Thing (LaDell Sisters) [recorded excerpt] -- (07:11) Godfrey introduces Hamilton -- (07:16) I've Got a Secret (George Hamilton IV) [recorded excerpt] -- (07:25) Godfrey introduces Angelo Peollete [unconfirmed] -- (07:30) [Unidentified Tune] (Angelo Peollete) [recorded excerpt] -- (07:42) Godfrey declares Peollete as the winner -- (08:10) Godfrey introduces Hamilton -- (08:28) I've Got a Secret (George Hamilton IV) -- (10:41) An unknown voice announces the commercial break -- (10:51) Pillsbury sponsored introduction of Arthur Godfrey -- (11:21) Godfrey and Hamilton talk about Hamilton's background and Payton's aspirations -- (12:21) Godfrey reads a letter from his extended family to Hamilton -- (13:39) An unknown voice introduces Hamilton -- (14:19) Hamilton greets the crowd and discusses how he misses the United States of America; although, not the weather -- (15:09) I've Got a Secret (George Hamilton IV) -- (18:11) An unknown voice thanks Hamilton for coming to Sydney, Australia and asks Hamilton for a photo -- (19:00) Hamilton and the unknown voice talk about Baby Ruth bars and address the meaning of "A Rose and a Baby Ruth" -- (19:47) A Rose and a Baby Ruth (George Hamilton) -- (22:05) The unknown voice shows his appreciation for Hamilton -- (22:17) Godfrey introduces Hamilton on the Arthur Godfrey Show -- (22:41) Sam (George Hamilton IV) -- (24:35) Godfrey tells of Hamilton's song writing and Hamilton tells of his aspirations -- (25:35) Godfrey and Hamilton talk about the women behind "Sam" -- (26:20) Hamilton talks about the careers of previous generations of George Hamilton's -- (27:02) Godfrey pokes fun at George Hamilton III for being a member of a competing product company -- (28:05) Jamaican Farwell (George Hamilton IV) -- (30:01) Godfrey declares that the show is a part of the CBS Network
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hamilton, George, IV, 1937-;
